item.title: Access History in IRB
item.description: Accessing the list of commands you have ran in your irb or rails console. Running the following command in your console Readline::HISTORY.to_a returns the array of commands you have typed in console. After which you can treat it like any other array in ruby - search, sort, etc.

item.title: Model Update_attribute Update_attributes
item.description: Lot of people might have a confusing between the functionality of update_attribute and update_attributes. The purpose of these functions can be understood from their name itself. the first one update_attribute would update a single attribute of the model
